name: TOWNSHIP OF NORTH FAYETTE v. COUNTY OF ALLEGHENY and Donald Berman, Individually and as the Director of the Allegheny County Department of Works. Appeal of COUNTY OF ALLEGHENY
name_abbreviation: Township of North Fayette v. County of Allegheny

judges: Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, NIX, MANDERINO and LARSEN, JJ.
parties: TOWNSHIP OF NORTH FAYETTE v. COUNTY OF ALLEGHENY and Donald Berman, Individually and as the Director of the Allegheny County Department of Works. Appeal of COUNTY OF ALLEGHENY.

opinions.text:
OPINION
PER CURIAM:
The petition for allowance of appeal having been improvidently granted, the appeal is dismissed.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Alexander J. Jaffurs, County Sol., Robert S. Barker, Asst. County Sol., Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Larry P. Gaitens, Lucchino, Gaitens & Hough, Pittsburgh, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
398 A.2d 657
TOWNSHIP OF NORTH FAYETTE v. COUNTY OF ALLEGHENY and Donald Berman, Individually and as the Director of the Allegheny County Department of Works. Appeal of COUNTY OF ALLEGHENY.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 6, 1979.
Decided March 14, 1979.
Alexander J. Jaffurs, County Sol., Robert S. Barker, Asst. County Sol., Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Larry P. Gaitens, Lucchino, Gaitens & Hough, Pittsburgh, for appellee.
Donald Berman, pro se.
Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, NIX, MANDERINO and LARSEN, JJ.
